lab_metadata.title: AWS WorkSpaces to Azure Virtual Desktop: Enterprise VDI and Application Streaming
lab_metadata.description: Master enterprise virtual desktop infrastructure by migrating from AWS WorkSpaces and AppStream to Azure Virtual Desktop with advanced management and security
prerequisites: Understanding of virtual desktop infrastructure concepts
Knowledge of Active Directory and identity management
Familiarity with Windows Server and desktop deployment
Basic understanding of networking and security
Knowledge of application deployment and management
learning_objectives: Migrate AWS WorkSpaces virtual desktops to Azure Virtual Desktop
Transform AWS AppStream application streaming to Azure RemoteApp
Convert AWS WorkDocs file sharing to Azure Files with sync
Implement Azure AD integration and conditional access
Configure application management and user profile solutions
Establish monitoring, security, and cost optimization

scenario.title: Remote Workforce VDI Migration
scenario.description: TechFlow Corporation supports 5,000+ remote employees across 20 countries using AWS WorkSpaces for virtual desktops and AppStream for application delivery. They need to migrate to Azure Virtual Desktop while improving user experience, reducing costs, and enhancing security.
business_requirements: Support for 5,000+ concurrent remote desktop sessions
Sub-100ms response time for optimal user experience
Enhanced security with conditional access and MFA
30% cost reduction compared to current AWS setup
current_aws_architecture: WorkSpaces with Standard and Performance bundles
WorkDocs for file sharing and collaboration
CloudWatch for monitoring and usage analytics
target_azure_architecture: Azure Virtual Desktop with pooled and personal desktops
Azure Files with FSLogix profile management
Azure AD with conditional access and MFA
Application Proxy for secure application access
Monitor and Log Analytics for comprehensive monitoring

lab_sections.title: Virtual Desktop Infrastructure: WorkSpaces to Azure Virtual Desktop
lab_sections.description: Migrate core VDI infrastructure with multi-session capabilities

key_features: Persistent virtual desktops with local storage

azure_equivalent.description: Modern desktop virtualization service with multi-session capabilities
key_features: Multi-session Windows 10/11 Enterprise for cost optimization
Pooled and personal desktop deployment options
FSLogix profile containers for user state management
Integrated security with Azure AD and conditional access

hands_on_exercises.title: Deploy Azure Virtual Desktop with Multi-Session Infrastructure

steps.description: Create Azure Virtual Desktop workspace and host pools
steps.aws_context: Similar to creating WorkSpaces directory and bundles

avd_infrastructure.workspace_creation: az desktopvirtualization workspace create --name TechFlow-Workspace --resource-group rg-avd --location eastus --description 'TechFlow Virtual Desktop Environment'

steps.explanation: Creates scalable VDI infrastructure with pooled and personal desktop options

steps.description: Configure session hosts with Windows 10/11 multi-session
steps.aws_context: Equivalent to WorkSpaces bundle configuration with applications

azure_cli_deployment: az vm create --name AVD-SessionHost-01 --resource-group rg-avd --image Win10-21H2-EVD --size Standard_D4s_v3 --vnet-name avd-vnet --subnet session-hosts --public-ip-address ''
# Install AVD Agent and Boot Loader on session hosts
# Join session hosts to host pool and Azure AD domain

steps.explanation: Deploys optimized Windows 10/11 multi-session hosts for better resource utilization

steps.description: Set up FSLogix profile containers for user state management
steps.aws_context: Similar to WorkSpaces user volume and roaming profile management

group_policy_settings: Enable Office 365 Container for better performance

steps.explanation: Provides seamless user experience with roaming profiles and application data

steps.description: Configure application groups and user assignments
steps.aws_context: Equivalent to WorkSpaces user assignment and application access
steps.explanation: Provides flexible application delivery based on user roles and requirements

validation: Verify host pools are created with correct configuration
Test session host deployment and domain join
Confirm FSLogix profiles load correctly for users
Validate application groups and user access permissions
